description.p: In an early version of the EasyRisk user guide, Risk Profile was simply defined as A risk as a function over time. In a later one, the term is also used for a graph presenting number of identified risk of each risk level for different organisational units at a given point in time.

The term is also used in other contexts, but there is no standard definition. It is commonly used in a conceptual sense to represent the entire portfolio of risks that constitute an enterprise. Some companies represent this portfolio in terms of a cumulative probability distribution (eg, of cumulative earnings) and use it as a base from which to determine the incremental impact (eg, on required capital) of alternative strategies or decisions. For investments e.g. in security funds, it is commonly used for an expression of the funds risk willingness.
With regard to safety, a presentation of estimated risk for a plant or installation, suitable for comparison with established risk acceptance criteria, is often denoted Risk Profile.
The term seems to be used in a lot of different contexts with different meaning, so may it be a bit dangerous for us to try to establish a specific definition?
